creator: charnjit.bhullar@cardifpinnacle.com
text:
TEST STEPS
==========
1. Added a response assertion to a HTTP request to analyse if the text Pattern specified is contained in the returning page.
2. Regular expression ${ExpectedResult} was used to define the text pattern I am looking for.
3. The value of this expression was set to pick up the second entry in a comma flat file.
4. The test is simply reading a flat (comma) file and searching on the first entry through Google. It then checks to see if the returned page contains the text in ${ExpectedResult} and fail if the result is false.
5. This works for search criteria "Duck" but not "Elephant".

I have attached the script and comma flat file I am using so you could run the test for yourself to re-produce the failure.

Look forward to your solution & Thanks in advance.

Regards.
The Google response for Elephant does not contain the text: Elephants are large It contains the text: Elephants are large so no wonder the Assertion fails.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
Thank You.

I was looking at the rendered HTML response, I will ensure that I look at the HTML code in the future.

Verified as Invalid Bug.

I am not sure about your procedures, does the reporter (Myself) or the JMeter developer (yourself) updates the status to closed after verification has been confirmed ?
creator: charnjit.bhullar@cardifpinnacle.com
sebb@apache.org
text:
Normally the JMeter team will close bugs, but for invalid ones it could also be the originator.

I'll close it.
